definition: Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]
lit. raging sea of bureaucracy/officials causing a big fuss

sentences.english: Sometimes a mediated conversation will straighten things out, and a little discussion and apology can calm the waters.
sentences.chinese: 有時調解可以弄清真相，討論和道歉能平息風波。

sentences.english: Many small firms did not weather the storm of the recession.
sentences.chinese: 許多小公司沒能經受住這次經濟衰退的風波。

sentences.english: Public opinion is volatile and prone to large swings.
sentences.chinese: 公衆意見是善變的，易受大風波的影響。

sentences.english: But the disclosure, such as it was, raised a little flurry of excitement in diplomatic and journalistic circles.
sentences.chinese: 但這次公開，在外交圈和記者圈裏引起一場小風波。

sentences.english: Later in my college life these were small events.
sentences.chinese: 後來又發生了一場小風波。

sentences.english: They’re afraid to make waves, and therefore, they avoid changes.
sentences.chinese: 他們害怕挑起風波，所以他們避免做出改變。

sentences.english: To celebrate their victory at the same time, taiping town also usher in a bigger storm.
sentences.chinese: 就在慶祝勝利同時，太平鎮也迎來更大的風波。

sentences.english: Last week was a week of serious financial turbulance in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 上週在歐洲是嚴重金融風波四起的一週。

sentences.english: Some fans in China relish how the album discomfits the establishment.
sentences.chinese: 一些中國歌迷紛紛談到這張專輯爲何會引起風波。

sentences.english: His arrest has sparked a diplomatic rumpus.
sentences.chinese: 他的被捕引起了一場外交風波。

sentences.english: After the storm, Fang Qiong began to observe small beautiful relationship with hai-yang zhuang.
sentences.chinese: 這場風波過後，方瓊又開始觀察小麗跟莊海洋的關係。

sentences.english: Yet for all that, occasionally they also will have a storm in a teacup.
sentences.chinese: 儘管如此，小兩口偶然也會有小風波的。

sentences.english: Can you sleep when the wind blows through your life?
sentences.chinese: 當你的生活颳起風波的時候，你是否能睡着覺呢？

sentences.english: All four governors have caused a stir by taking on public-sector unions.
sentences.chinese: 四位州長都曾因拿政府公共部門工會開刀而引起風波。

sentences.english: It tempts a political backlash, military demoralization and strategic confusion.
sentences.chinese: 它會導致政治風波，軍隊士氣消沉以及戰略混亂。

definition: to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
to lead to/to trigger/to initiate/to cause/to evoke (emotions)
storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
